name: RelativeDateTimeFormatter
desc: A formatter that creates locale-aware string representations of a relative date or time.

items.name: func localizedString(for: Date, relativeTo: Date) -> String
items.desc: Formats the date interval from the reference date to the specified date using the formatter’s calendar.

items.name: func localizedString(from: DateComponents) -> String
items.desc: Formats a relative time represented by the specified date components.

items.name: func localizedString(fromTimeInterval: TimeInterval) -> String
items.desc: Formats the specified time interval using the formatter’s calendar.

items.name: func string(for: Any?) -> String?
items.desc: Creates a formatted string for a date relative to the current date and time.

items.name: var calendar: Calendar!
items.desc: The calendar to use for formatting values that don’t have an inherent calendar of their own.

items.name: var locale: Locale!
items.desc: The locale to use when formatting the date.

items.name: var dateTimeStyle: RelativeDateTimeFormatter.DateTimeStyle
items.desc: The style to use when describing a relative date, for example “yesterday” or “1 day ago”.

items.name: enum RelativeDateTimeFormatter.DateTimeStyle
items.desc: A type that represents the style to use when formatting relative dates, such as “1 week ago” or “last week”.

items.name: var unitsStyle: RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle
items.desc: The style to use when formatting the quantity or the name of the unit, such as “1 day ago” or “one day ago”.

items.name: enum RelativeDateTimeFormatter.UnitsStyle
items.desc: A type that represents the style to use when formatting the units of relative dates.

items.name: var formattingContext: Formatter.Context
items.desc: A description of where the formatted string will appear, allowing the formatter to capitalize the output appropriately.
